docs.title: Pokemon Grand Colosseum Documentation
docs.text:
This documentation provides comprehensive information about Pokemon Grand Colosseum, including game changes, gameplay tips, and detailed Pokemon data.

Pokemon Grand Colosseum is a rom hack of Pokemon Colosseum by KyaColosseum. Please support KyaColosseum by following them on their socials and keeping up with their Twitter or streams on Twitch!

I (7decibel, the compiler of these docs) am not the original developer of Grand Colosseum and all documentation was included in the original release in .txt files which I have converted into this readable website.

docs.title: Getting Started
docs.text: Use the navigation menu on the left to browse through different sections of the documentation. You can also use the search function in the top navigation bar to find specific information.

docs.title: Contact
docs.text:
If you have any questions on the game itself, please contact Kya via Twitter or Twitch.

If you have any questions or suggestions ON SOLELY THE DOCUMENTATION OR THE WEBSITE, please contact me via Twitter. Or if you want to keep up with my own Pokemon Grand Colosseum playthrough, watch me on Twitch!

docs.title: Ability Changes
docs.text:
Global Changes

Most instances of Sturdy and Early Bird have been replaced by Rock Head or Insomnia respectively.

docs.title: Main Changes
docs.text:
The following are the major changes implemented in Grand Colosseum:

  • Physical / Special split
  • Fairy type added
  • 65 moves from later generations
  • Increased trainer difficulty
  • Changed shadow encounters
  • Trade and stone evolutions at level 40
  • Starters can now be female
  • Stat, type and ability changes for many Pokémon
  • TMs now have infinite use
  • 8 new TMs added
  • Spread damage multiplier increased from 0.5x to 0.75x (Like later gens)
  • Shadow Pokémon natures instantly viewable
  • Colosseum challenges made into pseudo gyms
  • Critical hit chance and multiplier changed to gen 6 onwards
  • Open PC and save anywhere using the R button

docs.title: Gameplay Improvements
docs.text:
• Can now save and access PC anywhere by pressing R
  • UI updated to show Physical/Special split
  • Text issues with status effects fixed
  • Mislabeled moves fixed
  • AI issues (mostly) resolved
  • Battle level curve smoothed out
  • Earlier access to certain moves

docs.title: Battle Mechanics
docs.text:
• Critical hit chance changed to Gen 7+ odds
  • Critical hit multiplier reduced from 2× to 1.5×
  • Type-boosting items increased from 1.1× to 1.2×

docs.title: Content Changes
docs.text:
• Some Shadow Pokémon changed or relocated
  • Master Ball moved to post-game
  • Paldean Tauros added

docs.title: EV Training Zones
docs.text:
The first 6 zones of Mount Battle have been converted into specialized EV training areas. All Pokémon in these zones only know the move Memento.

Berry Note

Each zone's Pokémon hold the EV-lowering berry corresponding to the EV they give (Except Pomeg Berry). However, in both vanilla and this rom hack, these berries do not work.

docs.title: Zone Layout
docs.text: Zone EV Trained Zone 1 Special Defense Zone 2 Defense Zone 3 Speed Zone 4 Special Attack Zone 5 Attack Zone 6 HP

docs.title: Challenge Zones
docs.text:
Zones 7-10 have been significantly enhanced and now feature the most challenging battles in the game.

Training Strategy

You can efficiently EV train your Pokémon by defeating multiple Pokémon in the corresponding zones. Since they only know Memento, they won't be able to damage your Pokémon, making training safer and easier.

docs.title: Mechanic Changes
docs.text: All moves have had their base powers and accuracy changed to match Generations V-VIII unless specified below.

docs.title: Power Changes
docs.text: Move Original Power New Power Additional Changes Bubble 20 40 - Twineedle 40 60 - Lick 30 20 Paralysis chance increased to 100% Triple Kick - 120 Accuracy: 75% Triple Axel - 120 Accuracy: 75% Flame Wheel 60 75 - Snore 40 80 - Dream Eater 100 120 - Rock Smash 20 60 Defense lowering chance 100% Arm Thrust 15 25 - Poison Fang 50 80 - Poison Tail 50 70 - Disarming Voice 40 60 - Bubblebeam 65 75 Speed lowering chance 100% Shadow Claw 70 80 - Aurora Beam 60 75 Attack lowering chance 100%

docs.title: Accuracy Changes
docs.text: Move Original Accuracy New Accuracy Bonemerang 90% 100% Grass Whistle 50% 65% Hypnosis 50% 65% Sing 50% 65% Clamp 70% 95%

docs.title: Other Changes
docs.text: Move Change Dizzy Punch Confusion chance increased to 50% Octazooka Accuracy lowering chance increased to 100% Shadow Rush No longer deals recoil damage X-Scissor Now has high critical hit ratio

Gym Challenge Format

Each location features multiple type-specialized challenges that function similar to traditional Pokémon gyms. These provide additional battle content and opportunities for training.

docs.title: Known Issues
docs.text: The following issues are known to exist in the current version of the game. Please keep these in mind while playing.

docs.title: Area of Effect Issues
docs.text:
• Bulldoze only hits opposing Pokémon (not allies)
  • The following moves can hit Pokémon using Dig during their invulnerable turn:
    • Discharge
    • Boomburst
    • Lava Plume
    • Sludge Wave
    • Surf

docs.title: Missing Effects
docs.text:
• Hurricane doesn't cause confusion
  • The following moves lack their secondary status effects:
    • Discharge (Paralysis)
    • Sludge Wave (Poison)
    • Lava Plume (Burn)

docs.title: Ability Interactions
docs.text: The following abilities completely cancel their respective moves instead of absorbing them: - Water Absorb vs Surf - Flash Fire vs Lava Plume - Volt Absorb vs Discharge

docs.title: Move Mechanics Changes
docs.text: Due to hardcoded power values: - Triple Kick and Triple Axel have been modified to have their power and accuracy combined into single hits

docs.title: Item Issues
docs.text: • Stat-reducing berries do not work (This is also an issue in vanilla game)

docs.title: AI Issues
docs.text:
• The AI still attempts to use Fake Out on Ghost-type Pokémon

Reporting Issues

If you discover any issues not listed here, please report them to the development team.

docs.title: Shadow Pokémon Guide
docs.text:
Spoiler Alert

This page contains a complete list of all Shadow Pokémon encounters in the game. If you want to discover them yourself, do not read further!

docs.title: Shadow Pokémon List
docs.text:
The following list shows all Shadow Pokémon in order of encounter. The number represents the order in which they can be found.

Version Differences

Entries marked with * indicate that the Shadow Pokémon encountered will vary depending on your version of the game, which are Kanto, Johto, or Hoenn.

docs.title: Tips for Success
docs.text: If you're finding the game challenging, here are some helpful tips to improve your gameplay experience.

docs.title: Rare Candies
docs.text:
• Available at Pyrite Poké Mart
  • Price: 9,800 PokéDollars
  • Special Price in Nuzlocke Mode: 1 PokéDollar

docs.title: Training Locations
docs.text:
• Mount Battle Area 6 is excellent for quick and easy grinding
  • Pyrite Square offers rematch battles for additional experience

docs.title: When Underleveled
docs.text:
If you're underleveled for certain battles, here's where to train:

If stuck at... Try these locations first Dakim Pyrite Square Rematch Fights Venus - Phenac Stadium- Mirakle B Battle- Justy Fight Ein Pyrite Colosseum (can be done before or after) Gonzap The Under Colosseum (do just before or after)

docs.title: Defensive Moves
docs.text:
The following moves can significantly improve your chances of success: - Light Screen - Reflect - Protect

Colosseum Progression

The Colosseums are designed to be completed at specific points during your journey. Don't feel pressured to complete them immediately when you discover them - you can return when your team is stronger.

Nuzlocke Players

The 1 PokéDollar Rare Candy price in Nuzlocke mode helps maintain challenge while reducing grinding time.

docs.title: Format Template
docs.text:
Each trainer entry should follow this format:

### Trainer Name (ID)
Location: [Area]
Reward: [Money/Items if applicable]

#### Pokemon 1
- Level: XX
- Nature: XXX
- Ability: XXX
- Held Item: XXX
- EVs: XXX HP / XXX Atk / XXX Def / XXX SpA / XXX SpD / XXX Spe
- Moves:
  - Move 1
  - Move 2
  - Move 3
  - Move 4

[Repeat for each Pokemon in team]
